alert.note: Alert for Eastern Aleutians (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: High Wind Watch issued February 15 at 3:57PM AKST until February 16 at 9:00PM AKST by NWS Anchorage
info.description: ...HIGH WIND WATCH IN EFFECT FROM THURSDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH THURSDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Southwest winds 45 to 60 mph with gusts up to 75 mph possible. * WHERE...Eastern Aleutians. * WHEN...From Thursday afternoon through Thursday evening. * IMPACTS...High winds could move loose debris, damage property, and cause power outages. Travel could be difficult. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...There is significant potential for a brief period of high winds in the eastern Aleutians Thursday afternoon or evening. Timing and strength of the winds will depend on the exact track of a low developing in the eastern Bering Sea on Thursday. The likelihood of high winds increases for locations further east, with the greatest probability of high winds expected for Dutch Harbor and a lower probability for Nikolski.
info.instruction: A high wind watch means there is potential for a hazardous high wind event. Monitor the latest forecasts and warnings for updates on this situation. Fasten loose objects or shelter objects in a safe location prior to the onset of winds.
